Corporate Law.question: The Governing Board of the Corporate Affairs Commission (“CAC”) comprises how many members?
Corporate Law.reason: The governing board of CAC comprises 12 members. See Section 2 of CAMA 2020.

Corporate Law.question: The quorum for the meeting of the Board of the Corporate Affairs Commission is?
Corporate Law.reason: The quorum for the meeting of the governing board of CAC is 5. See Section 6(3) CAMA 2020.

Corporate Law.question: The following are the types of business organizations recognised by the Companies and Allied Matters Act except
Corporate Law.reason: While the concept of incorporated Trustees are recognised by CAMA 2020, you should note that a key feature of Incorporated Trustees is that they are not allowed to engage in business. This is a key difference between it and company limited by guarantee as the later is allowed to do business but cannot distribute the profit to members

Corporate Law.question: The form for application for registration of the company is:
Corporate Law.reason: The form used for the registration of a company is Form CAC 1.1 headed “Application to Register a Company”.

Corporate Law.question: The Attorney General is required to grant approval within how many days where there are no objections for a company limited by guarantee
Corporate Law.reason: The Attorney General of the Federation shall, within 30 days, grant authority to register a company limited by guarantee where there are no objections or any other cogent reason to refuse the grant. See Section 26(5) of CAMA.

Corporate Law.question: The minimum number of trustees that may apply for registration under Part F of CAMA is:
Corporate Law.reason: The minimum number of trustees that can be registered under part F is 2. See Section 823(1) of CAMA.

Corporate Law.question: The CAC form to fill when filing the annual returns of a business name is:
Corporate Law.reason: CAC/BN/6 is headed “Annual Return of Business Names

Corporate Law.question: Who can bring an application for the dissolution of Heroes for Nigeria (An Incorporated Trustee)?

options.c: Members of the association constituting not less than 50% of the total membership

Corporate Law.reason: Section 850 of CAMA.

Corporate Law.question: The Stamp Duty payable on the Memorandum and Articles of Association of a company is?
Corporate Law.reason: The stamp duty payable on the MEMOART is fixed, while that of the statement of minimum share capital (now CAC 1.1) is ad valorem.

Corporate Law.question: Which of the following is not required to have a special clause?
Corporate Law.reason: A company limited by guarantee and an Incorporated Trustee are required to have a special clause in their MEMART/Constitution respectively. The special clause is to the effect that the income and property of the company or association will be applied solely towards the object, and no part of it shall be distributable to members, even if the company or association winds up.

Corporate Law.question: There can be more than one promoter to a company
Corporate Law.reason: All subscribers to a memorandum are regarded as promoters. The law does not provide for any minimum nor maximum. see section 85 CAMA 2020

Corporate Law.question: One of the following upheld the CAMA provision that a pre incorporation contract may be ratified by the company upon incorporation.

options.b: Societe Generale Bank v Societe Generale Favouriser
options.d: Societe Generale Bank v Sem Edowire

Corporate Law.answer: Societe Generale Bank v Societe Generale Favouriser
Corporate Law.reason: Kelner v. Baxter is the authority on the common law principle that pre-incorporation contract are not valid. section 96(2) CAMA 2020 changes this provison and Societe Generale Bank is the new position on this

Corporate Law.question: The saying `an exempted company has the status of unregistered company` means none but one of the following:

options.a: An exempted company is exempted from payment of company taxes
options.b: An exempted company is exempted from filing annual reports
options.c: An exempted company cannot sue or be sued in Nigeria
options.d: An exempted company is exempted from holding General meetings

Corporate Law.answer: An exempted company is exempted from payment of company taxes
Corporate Law.reason: When we say an exempted company has the status of an unregistered company, it means that, among others, the company is exempted from the payment of taxes in Nigeria.

Corporate Law.question: An incentive that allows you get back import duties paid is:
Corporate Law.reason: Duty drawback scheme is the tax incentive that allows importers of materials used in the manufacture of exported goods may claim repayment of import duties earlier paid in respect of the materials. The application for duty drawback must be made within a maximum of two years from the date of exportation.

Corporate Law.question: The maximum accumulated tax holiday available to an industry with pioneer status in Nigeria is:
Corporate Law.reason: Pioner Status grants one tax holiday for three years with a further possible extension for 2 extra years thus making it 5 years in total

Corporate Law.question: CERPAC means:

options.a: Combined Expatriate Registration Permit Authorised Card
options.b: Combined Expatriate Residence Permit and Aliens Credit
options.c: Combined Expatriate Residence Permit and Allowance Card.
options.d: Combined Expatriate Residence Permit and Aliens Card.

Corporate Law.answer: Combined Expatriate Residence Permit and Aliens Card.
Corporate Law.reason: CERPAC stands for Combined Expatriate Residence Permit and Aliens Card. The card is also referred to as green card.

Corporate Law.question: The procedure for change of name is contained in what section of CAMA?
Corporate Law.reason: The procedure for a change of a company name is contained in Section 30 of CAMA 2020.

Corporate Law.question: The theory of good corporate governance which posits that the company has more than the interest of its owners and employees at stake, but also that of the General public is:
Corporate Law.reason: The stakeholder theory of corporate governance considers the public interest among other things because it views the public as necessary stakeholder in corporate actions.

Corporate Law.question: The decision of the Board of Directors is usually
Corporate Law.reason: The decision of the board of directors is taken to be a unanimous resolution.

Corporate Law.question: Failure to file annual returns for a consecutive period of __________ is a ground for striking the name of a company off the companies register:
Corporate Law.reason: Failure to file annual returns for a consecutive period of 10 years is a ground for striking the name of a company off the companies register. See Section 425 (3) of CAMA.
